Description: Fragment of a very thin cloth in undyed linen plain weave with a band of tapestry in purple wool; the band is decorated with different medallions, medallions are in purple on a beige and purple background gained by using, alternatively beige and purple threads; the one in the middle has a human figure (male?) wearing a short tunic and holding an object in his left and right hands (maybe a cup?); on each side of the figure are animals running to the left, from right to left is one feline, one dog, one gazelle and another feline; on the right of the band is a plain semi-circle in purple wool indicating this is the end of the band, although the selvedge is not preserved; edges cut and ragged; probably a furnishing textile; plain weave:warp-undyed linen (S/36), weft-undyed linen (S/22); tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S/20), weft-undyed linen (S) and purple wool (S); flying threads-undyed linen (S)
Bibliographic references: Budge 1922 / British Museum. Guide to the fourth, fifth and sixth Egyptian rooms, and the Coptic room (p.227) (Table case H, no. 2)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
